summary:
## Quadratic Equations Explained Simply

A quadratic equation looks like this:  **ax² + bx + c = 0**.

It's an equation with a variable (x) raised to the power of 2 (x²).  The numbers a, b, and c are called coefficients.

These equations have up to two solutions, called "roots".  Sometimes, the roots are real numbers, and sometimes they're imaginary ("complex") numbers. You can find the roots using a formula called the "quadratic formula".

People have been solving quadratic equations for thousands of years!
title: Quadratic equation
